title: 353-C
statement: C. Find Maximumtime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutValera has arraya, consisting ofnintegersa0,a1, ...,an- 1, and functionf(x), taking an integer from0to2n- 1as its single argument. Valuef(x)is calculated by formula, where valuebit(i)equals one if the binary representation of numberxcontains a1on thei-th position, and zero otherwise.For example, ifn= 4andx= 11(11 = 20+ 21+ 23), thenf(x) =a0+a1+a3.Help Valera find the maximum of functionf(x)among allx, for which an inequality holds:0 ≤x≤m.InputThe first line contains integern(1 ≤n≤ 105)— the number of array elements. The next line containsnspace-separated integersa0,a1, ...,an- 1(0 ≤ai≤ 104)— elements of arraya.The third line contains a sequence of digits zero and one without spacess0s1...sn- 1— the binary representation of numberm. Numbermequals.OutputPrint a single integer — the maximum value of functionf(x)for all.ExamplesInput23 810Output3Input517 0 10 2 111010Output27NoteIn the first test casem= 20= 1,f(0) = 0,f(1) =a0= 3.In the second samplem= 20+ 21+ 23= 11, the maximum value of function equalsf(5) =a0+a2= 17 + 10 = 27.
